column4: So, I'm looking to getting into developing ontop of ubuntu, where do I start?
what language?
thinking c, c++, but i'm fluent in python
for c and c++ 'apt-get install build-essential' would get you the basics installed
outside of that, google is your friend - there is a lot of stuff on blogs out there for specific languages/environments
thank you sir
glad to help - hope that gets you started at least :-)
when it's installed, where are the help docs stored? /usr/share?
ha, not really sure - never went looking for them :-/
haha, I guess I should do a linux from scratch build then :P
but yeah, the package list is in /usr/share/build-essential
i wouldn't go that far, unless you really want to. if development is your goal, Ubuntu is as good as any distro  (or LFS for that matter)
most of my dev stuff on Ubuntu is hacking on Ruby on Rails
i'm also a C#/F# dev, so I spent most of my time developing on a Win7 box actually
ah, noted, I'm a web dude originally, but now I'm starting to think about how to build standalone software that I can decouple from my apps

I kind of need to get down and dirty with the inner os workings, it's getting to a point weher I just want to have socket connections and only user http to server up pages rather thene raw data. with the advent of gevent, I've wondered how hard it is to make my own app in c/c++ that implments the http protocol on my own. It's more of an educational exorcise. I just picked up the book on unix sockets to get me started
thanks again for the direction!
np - if you want to learn more about the inner workings of linux, take a look at Arch Linux
easier than LFS, but will still teach you TONS
interesting
ok man - gotta run for now, but good luck with your project!
peace, thanks again!
